metadata.title: CVE-2019-12984 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference vulnerability in the functionnfc_genl_deactivate_target() in net/nfc/netlink.c in the Linux kernelbefore 5.1.13 can be triggered by a malicious user-mode program that omitscertain NFC attributes, leading to denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12984` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64
No subscription required

No subscription required
